SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Badge
The interface Badge is used to collect BadgeEndGame(Singleton) and BadgeScore(enum).
BadgeEndGame
We use Singleton pattern (Eager Singleton), because BadgeEndGame has only one instance.
BadgeScore
BadgeScore enumeration defines four different types of BadgeScore with their corresponding scores (2, 4, 6, 8).
BoardParser
 
BoardWriter
 
Cell
This class represents the cell in the Shelfie.
ChatController
This class is used to send chat messages through ServerSide
ChatParser
 
ChatWriter
 
CLI
Command Line Interface for MyShelfie
ClientHandler
This class manages the communication between Controller and ClientSide for a single Client
ClientRemoteInterface
Interface that defines the available RMI client methods
ClientSide
Class used to manage tcp connection client side
ClientSideMethods
Class that implements the methods for the RMI client interface
ClientSideRMI
Class used when the client wants to establish an RMI connection
ClientSignatureWriter
 
ColumnsOfMaxDiffTypes
This class implements the method verifyShape() to check if the shelfie has the target number (target_ColumnsOfMaxDiffTypes) of completed columns with no more than a certain number of different colors (maxDiffTypes_ColumnsOfMaxDiffTypes).
CommonCards
This class is the abstract representation of the CommonCards of the game, it's extended by all the different types of CommonCards.
CommonCardWriter
Create JSON containing Common Cards Info
CommonOperationsFramework
Contains two main methods used by UI to communicate with server
CommunicationProtocolParser
Class used to read the json config files for client and server
ConfirmWriter
 
Constants
This class is used to collect all the constants that are useful in the game.
Controller
General controller with functions of: - managing ChatController and GameController (which also controls the shelfie and the board); - communicating using ServerMessageHandler
CornersOfEquals
This class implements the method verifyShape() to check if the four tiles of the corners of the shelfie have the same color.
DiagonalOfEquals
This class implements the method verifyShape() to check if the shelfie contains a diagonal of five tiles of the same color.
EndGameController
Manage end game screen in GUI
EndGameWriter
 
ErrorWriter
 
FourGroupsOfFourEquals
This class implements the method verifyShape() to check if the shelfie contains four groups each containing at least four tiles of the same color.
Game
This is the main class of the model, it represents the game and connects all the subclasses.
GameBoard
Model representation of GameBoard
GameController
This class allows to communicate gameMoves and the start of a game to the Model.
GameMoveParser
 
GameMoveWriter
 
GUIAppl
Used to start GUI
GUIClientSide
Main class of Graphic User Interface for MyShelfie
GUIGameController
Manage game screen for GUI
GUILoginController
Manage login screen for GUI
GUIRegistry
Used to memorize reference to GUI chose by users
IllegalInsertException
 
LoginManagerV2
Class that manages the logins from both rmi and socket users for a match
LoginParser
 
LoginWriter
 
MessageHandler
Manage messages received by Socket and eventually update and visualize updated Shelfie, Board
MyShelfie
This class with its main method, is used to run MyShelfie Application.
NEqualTiles
This class implements the method verifyShape() to check if the shelfie contains "n" tiles of the same color.
PersonalCards
This class represents Personal Achievement of the cards.
PersonalCards.ObjectiveCell
This class represents a specific colored cell (row, column) of the shelfie, that composes the PersonalCard.
PersonalCardsParser
 
PersonalCardWriter
 
Player
This class is the model representation of player.
PlayerParser
 
PlayerWriter
 
RequestParser
 
RowsOfMaxDiffTypes
This class verifies if the shelfie has 'n' completed rows of maximum 'm' different colors (types), 'n' and 'm' are two configurable parameters (target and maxDifferentColor).
Score
This class contains some static methods useful for score calculation
Score.Mode
enum to distinguish two different modes: ROW and COLUMN It is used for verifyMaxDifferentColor() method
ServerMessageHandler
This class decodes JSON messages received from ClientHandler using JSON Parsers.
ServerRemoteInterface
Interface listing the methods exposed by the server to rmi users
ServerSide
General class managing the server side communications
ServerSideMethods
Class that implements the methods exposed to the rmi users
ServerSideRMI
Class used to accept and manage rmi clients server side
ServerSideTCP
Class used to handle the tcp connection server side
ServerSignatureWriter
 
Shelfie
This class is the representation of shelfie.
ShelfieParser
the class implements the parser for the commands regarding the shelfie
ShelfieWriter
 
SixGroupsOfTwoEquals
This class implements the method verifyShape() to check if the shelfie contains six groups each containing at least two tiles of the same color.
Stairs
This class implements the method verifyShape() to check if the shelfie contains "stairs": five columns of increasing or decreasing height, starting from the first column on the left or on the right; each next column must be made of exactly one more tile.
Tile
This class represents the tiles used in game.
Tile.TileColor
 
TileBag
This class contains a "bag" with every tile available in the game.
TwoColumnsOfSixDifferent
This class implements the method verifyShape() to check if the shelfie has two completed columns each formed by 6 different types of tiles.
TwoRowsOfFiveDifferent
This class implements the method verifyShape() to check if the shelfie has two completed rows each formed by 5 different types of tiles.
TwoSquaresOfEquals
This class implements the method verifyShape() to check if the shelfie has two 2x2 squares of tiles of the same type.
UI
UI interfaces shows method that CLI and GUI implements to show information about game
XOfEquals
This class implements the method verifyShape() to check if the shelfie has five tiles of the same type forming an X.
